review_title: Constant changes, SUNY system low pay
pros: It depends on the department and dean. Some are easy to work in/with and others are just a hot mess. Many of the faculty want to teach and help the students. If in a tenure track position, once tenure is given you don't have to do much beyond the minimum. Much of the newer (tenure track) hires are warm, friendly, inclusive, and enthusiastic.
cons: A number of the older, tenured faculty do the bare minimum and nothing is done about them. At the bottom of the pay scale for SUNY system in all teaching placements. Deans who micro-manage; SUNY system not providing needed lines for professors; SUNY system not allowing staff to test for admin asst positions which are desperately needed; turnover of admin at high levels meaning constant changes in directives (the college is on its third president since Kleniewski retired - one being an appointed interim who didn't even have a PhD); as an adjunct most departments won't include you in meetings or decisions and your contract can be withdrawn at any time.

review_title: Students run the school, and faculty take a back seat.
pros: Beautiful surroundings and quaint town. The city is in the middle of some lovely mountains and looks like something out of "It's A Wonderful Life."
cons: Students are given free reign to do whatever they want, without accountability, while faculty struggle to maintain control of the classroom and campus. Too many student groups on campus. Academics are secondary to sports and student clubs and smoking up and drinking.

review_title: SUNY Oneonta has many great employment opportunities for students
pros: While I was a student at SUNY Oneonta, I worked two jobs and, thus, learned how to work in and office and how to be a professional.  These early professional opportunities were invaluable experiences as I began my career, and I will always think fondly on my time at Oneonta.   Furthermore, the city of Oneonta is incredibly picturesque and safe; it would be a great place to raise a family.
cons: I can't think of anything negative to write about SUNY Oneonta.

job_title: James M Milne Library Student Associate in Oneonta, NY
pros: Helpful management, really nice people to work with, flexible hours, pay raises, ability to take on more hours (up to 20 hours per week), optional overnight shifts for finals week ($15/hr or more now, not certain.) I know some have went on to working full time as librarians here.
cons: I have no cons to share about working at Milne Library. It is a relatively intensive and lengthy training process when you start, which some find to be a con. I personally liked this about the job.

job_title: Financial Aid Advisor in Oneonta, NY
pros: Overall, the entire staff on the administration is friendly and helpful. The staff and organizations supports employees to continue to pursue their education both part time and full time. The work ours are great 37.5 per week and the summer you can take a 30 min lunch and work like 8-4.
cons: I was got in a middle of a power play between a supervisor going out and new supervisors coming in. I had support from other colleagues to help weather the storm.

review_title: A great administrative position to those who are looking to get their foot in the door of the higher education world.
job_title: Student Admissions Assistant in Farmingdale, NY
pros: Friendly staff, employers understanding of students' needs, student support
cons: Conflict among professional staff members, minimal room for leadership development

review_title: A great Campus with an amazing feel. Good faculty and staff.
pros: The students  are great and the feel of the campus is really a unique atmosphere in itself. The views are amazing in the fall.
cons: The weather is crazy sometimes. We get alot of snow followed by warm days followed by snow again. Very hard to predict when winter is really over and when it even starts.

job_title: Office of Student Accounts Staff Assistant in Sidney Center, NY
pros: Work tends to run over into lunch or late after the shift is over.  Occasionally have to interact with some unfriendly employees that have worked here for far too long.
cons: Considerable amount of awesome fellow employees.  Great hours.  Good management.  Great work environment overall.

review_title: Great summer job for collage students
job_title: Grounds Crew Member in Oneonta, NY
pros: Great summer job for collage students. Get to work full time and earn more that minimum wage. People are really friendly.
cons: Have to work outside even when it rains. Sometimes there isn't anything to do where other times you are really busy.

job_title: Maintenance Crew Member in Oneonta, NY
pros: The pay is great and its a very relaxed atmosphere
cons: Labor intensive, lots of lifting and carrying things. Lots of medial tasks like cleaning window blinds. The people are friendly if they like you or they make your life very difficult if they dont.

pros: I learned a lot about leadership, teamwork, time management, conflict management, programing, and door decorations. It was a great experience for 4 semesters. I learned how to work on a team of different people and how to interact with residents.
cons: Conflict among the staff was troublesome and hindered our flow. Clicks amongst us were not great for the whole group.

pros: Flexible hours and there are incentives like a 50 cent raise after one year of working there.
cons: There are none. Most people would say the coaching but I see that as a way to improve my performance.

review_title: Beautiful area, low cost of living
pros: Beautiful landscape, especially in the summer and fall. Low cost of living. Small city with tight community. Academic freedom is strong. Union is strong.
cons: Workload creep. Never ending changes to policies and procedures. High turn over of administrators. Not much support to do innovative programming.

job_title: Infant Teachers Assistant in Oneonta, NY
pros: This is a great place to work. Everyone is super friendly, all working towards the same goal of taking care of the children and their welfare. Family oriented and very aware of ones personal time.
cons: Parking is limited, and it is worse when there is snow.
